title.narrative: Sustainable Community Development Project of the Poor Ethnic Communities Along Nu and Lancang Watersheds of Yunnan

description.narrative: The Sustainable Community Development Project of the Poor Ethnic Communities Along Nu and Lancang Watersheds of Yunnan is a continuation of the principles and methods of project 22-0017-74 (Sustainable Livelihood Improvement and Holistic Community Development Project for the Poor Ethnic Communities around the Environmental Protection Areas of Yunnan). The Nu and Lancang Watersheds are impoverished and environmentally sensitive. A total of 15 poor ethnic communities living in the hillsides of these two areas of Yunnan will be served by this project. Heifer will support 500 poor households in sustainable agriculture and community development by providing beef cattle, swine and/or meat goats, raw materials and a series of technical trainings. Community harmony and farmers’ participation will be improved through trainings in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones and self-help group (SHG) management, as well as community participatory development planning. An additional 1,000 households in these communities will benefit through Heifer’s Pass on the Gift process. The communities will participate in local natural conservation through community-based protection. Children in these communities will be educated and organized to join conservation group activities. In each community, Heifer will carry out gender training and help form women-only SHGs (of the 60 SHGs in the project, at least 15 will be for women only). In all participating SHGs, women will be empowered to provide leadership to include management of the SHG community fund in order to improve the economic situation of their families.
